emulib.runtime

Class ContextPool

  • java.lang.Object
    • emulib.runtime.ContextPool

  • public class ContextPool
extends Object
    This class manages all plug-in contexts. Plug-ins should register their contexts manually. Other plug-ins that have permissions, can gather contexts by querying this pool. Context pool is not thread safe.

    • Method Detail

      • register

        public void register(long pluginID,
                     Context context,
                     Class<? extends Context> contextInterface)
              throws AlreadyRegisteredException,
                     InvalidContextException
        This method registers plug-in's context interface. The registration is needed because of contexts centralization. Other plug-ins can get a context by querying the pool. Usually, emuStudio does the job during loading of the virtual computer. Requirements for the context are: - It is allowed to implement one and only one context - context interface must extend Context interface provided by emuLib - context interface must be annotated with @ContextType annotation
        Parameters:
        pluginID - owner plugin ID of the context contextsByOwner
        context - The context object that the plug-in want to register
        contextInterface - The interface that the context has to implement
        Throws:
        AlreadyRegisteredException - Raised when a plug-in tries to register context that is already registered.
        InvalidContextException - Raised when a class does not implement given interface, or it is not annotated, or if the context interface does not fulfill context requirements.

      • unregister

        public boolean unregister(long pluginID,
                          Class<? extends Context> contextInterface)
                   throws InvalidContextException
        Unregisters all contexts of given context interface. It will do it only if the plug-in has the permission. The permission is approved if and only if the contexts are implemented inside the plug-in.
        Parameters:
        pluginID - plugin ID of the context owner
        contextInterface - the context interface
        Returns:
        true if at least one context was unregistered successfully, false otherwise.
        Throws:
        InvalidContextException - Raised when context interface is not annotated, or if the context interface does not fulfill context requirements.

      • setComputer

        public boolean setComputer(String password,
                           PluginConnections computer)
                    throws InvalidPasswordException
        Set a computer, represented as plug-in connections, loaded by emuStudio. This method should be called only by the emuStudio.
        Parameters:
        password - emuStudio password
        computer - virtual computer, loaded by emuStudio
        Returns:
        true if computer was set successfully; false otherwise.
        Throws:
        InvalidPasswordException - if the password was incorrect

      • clearAll

        public void clearAll(String password)
              throws InvalidPasswordException
        Clear the context instance.
        Parameters:
        password - emuStudio password
        Throws:
        InvalidPasswordException - if the password was incorrect

      • getContext

        public <T extends Context> T getContext(long pluginID,
                                        Class<T> contextInterface,
                                        int index)
                                 throws InvalidContextException,
                                        ContextNotFoundException
        Get plug-in context.
        Type Parameters:
        T - Specific context type
        Parameters:
        pluginID - ID of requesting plug-in
        contextInterface - wanted context interface (implemented by the plug-in)
        index - the index if more than one context are found. If -1 is provided, any matched context is used
        Returns:
        requested context, which plugin owner != pluginId
        Throws:
        InvalidContextException - if the context interface does not fulfil context requirements
        ContextNotFoundException - if the context does not exist or the plug-in is not allowed to get it

      • getCPUContext

        public <T extends CPUContext> T getCPUContext(long pluginID,
                                              Class<T> contextInterface)
                                       throws InvalidContextException,
                                              ContextNotFoundException
        Get registered CPU context. If plug-in doesn't have the permission to access it, return null. The permission is approved, when the plug-in is connected to the CPU in the abstract schema. If the CPU has more than one context implementing required context interface, the first one is returned. To access other ones, use extended version of the method. This method call is equivalent to the call of getCPUContext(pluginID, contextInterface, -1);
        Type Parameters:
        T - Specific CPU context
        Parameters:
        pluginID - plug-in requesting the CPU context
        contextInterface - Interface of the context
        Returns:
        CPUContext object if it is found and the plug-in has the permission to access it; null otherwise
        Throws:
        InvalidContextException - if the context interface does not fulfil context requirements
        ContextNotFoundException - if the context does not exist or the plug-in is not allowed to get it

      • getCPUContext

        public <T extends CPUContext> T getCPUContext(long pluginID,
                                              Class<T> contextInterface,
                                              int index)
                                       throws InvalidContextException,
                                              ContextNotFoundException
        Get registered CPU context (extended version). If plug-in doesn't have the permission to access it, return null. The permission is approved, when the plug-in is connected to the CPU in the abstract schema. If the CPU has more than one context implementing required context interface, it returns context indexed by index parameter.
        Type Parameters:
        T - Specific CPU Context
        Parameters:
        pluginID - plug-in requesting the CPU context
        contextInterface - Interface of the context
        index - 0-based the order of the context if they are more than one. Does nothing if the index is out of the bounds. If index is -1, it uses any found context.
        Returns:
        CPUContext object if it is found and the plug-in has the permission; null otherwise
        Throws:
        InvalidContextException - if the context interface does not fulfil context requirements
        ContextNotFoundException - if the context does not exist or the plug-in is not allowed to get it

      • getCompilerContext

        public <T extends CompilerContext> T getCompilerContext(long pluginID,
                                                        Class<T> contextInterface)
                                                 throws InvalidContextException,
                                                        ContextNotFoundException
        Get registered compiler context. If plug-in doesn't have the permission to access it, return null. The permission is approved, when the plug-in is connected to the compiler in the abstract schema. If the compiler has more than one context implementing required context interface, the first one is returned. To access other ones, use extended version of the method. This method call is equivalent to the call of getCompilerContext(pluginID, contextInterface, -1);
        Type Parameters:
        T - Specific compiler context
        Parameters:
        pluginID - plug-in requesting the compiler context
        contextInterface - Interface of the context, if requesting plugin has permission to acccess it
        Returns:
        CompilerContext object if it is found and the plug-in has the permission to access it; null otherwise
        Throws:
        InvalidContextException - if the context interface does not fulfil context requirements
        ContextNotFoundException - if the context does not exist or the plug-in is not allowed to get it

      • getCompilerContext

        public <T extends CompilerContext> T getCompilerContext(long pluginID,
                                                        Class<T> contextInterface,
                                                        int index)
                                                 throws InvalidContextException,
                                                        ContextNotFoundException
        Get registered compiler context (extended version). If plug-in doesn't have the permission to access it, return null. The permission is approved, when the plug-in is connected to the compiler in the abstract schema. If the compiler has more than one context implementing required context interface, it returns context indexed by index parameter.
        Type Parameters:
        T - Specific compiler context
        Parameters:
        pluginID - plug-in requesting the Compiler context
        contextInterface - Interface of the context
        index - the order of the context if they are more than one. Does nothing if the index is out of bounds. If the index is -1, it uses any found context.
        Returns:
        CompilerContext object if it is found and the plug-in has the permission to access it; null otherwise
        Throws:
        InvalidContextException - if the context interface does not fulfil context requirements
        ContextNotFoundException - if the context does not exist or the plug-in is not allowed to get it

The permission is approved, when the plug-in is connected to the memory in the abstract schema. This method call is equivalent to the call of getMemoryContext(pluginID, contextInterface, -1);

        Parameters:
        pluginID - plug-in requesting the memory context
        contextInterface - Interface of the context
        Returns:
        MemoryContext object if it is found and the plug-in has the permission to access it; null otherwise
        Throws:
        InvalidContextException - if the context interface does not fulfil context requirements
        ContextNotFoundException - if the context does not exist or the plug-in is not allowed to get it

      • getDeviceContext

        public <T extends DeviceContext> T getDeviceContext(long pluginID,
                                                    Class<T> contextInterface)
                                             throws InvalidContextException,
                                                    ContextNotFoundException
        Get registered device context. If plug-in doesn't have the permission to access it, return null. The permission is approved, when the plug-in is connected to the device in the abstract schema. If the device has more than one context implementing required context interface, the first one is returned. To access other ones, use extended version of the method. This method call is equivalent to the call of getDeviceContext(pluginID, contextInterface, -1);
        Type Parameters:
        T - Specific device context
        Parameters:
        pluginID - plug-in requesting the device context
        contextInterface - Interface of the context
        Returns:
        DeviceContext object if it is found and the plug-in has the permission to access it; null otherwise
        Throws:
        InvalidContextException - if the context interface does not fulfil context requirements
        ContextNotFoundException - if the context does not exist or the plug-in is not allowed to get it

      • getDeviceContext

        public <T extends DeviceContext> T getDeviceContext(long pluginID,
                                                    Class<T> contextInterface,
                                                    int index)
                                             throws InvalidContextException,
                                                    ContextNotFoundException
        Get registered device context (extended version). If plug-in doesn't have the permission to access it, return null. The permission is approved, when the plug-in is connected to the device in the abstract schema. If the device has more than one context implementing required context interface, it returns context indexed by index parameter.
        Type Parameters:
        T - Specific device context
        Parameters:
        pluginID - plug-in requesting the device context
        contextInterface - Interface of the context
        index - index of the context implementation. Does nothing if the index is out of bounds. If the index is -1, it uses any found context.
        Returns:
        DeviceContext object if it is found and the plug-in has the permission to access it; null otherwise
        Throws:
        InvalidContextException - if the context interface does not fulfil context requirements
        ContextNotFoundException - if the context does not exist or the plug-in is not allowed to get it

      • computeHash

        public static String computeHash(Class<? extends Context> contextInterface)
        Compute emuStudio-specific hash of the context interface. The name of the interface is not important, only method names and their signatures. The final processing uses SHA-1 method.
        Parameters:
        contextInterface - interface to compute hash of
        Returns:
        SHA-1 hash string of the interface

      • SHA1

        public static String SHA1(String text)
                   throws NoSuchAlgorithmException,
                          UnsupportedEncodingException
        Compute SHA-1 hash string. Letters in the hash string will be in upper-case.
        Parameters:
        text - Data to make hash from
        Returns:
        SHA-1 hash Hexadecimal string, null if there was some error
        Throws:
        NoSuchAlgorithmException - self-descriptive
        UnsupportedEncodingException - self-descriptive
